column4: has anyone simmilar problam that I have. I just installed kubuntu 6.10 and when I tryed intstall libxine-extracodecs occured problem: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/26918/
you are missing some repositories.  Can you pastebin your sources.list
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/26915/
you have the main repository commented (as well as others)
are you comfortable editing that file yourself, or want some help?
don't know which are main
lines 2 and 4 have the main and restricted repos.  lines 9 and 11 have the dapper-updates, 34 and 37 give you security updates
to edit the file, just opena a terminal and run 'gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list'.  Then remove the initial # sign in front of those lines.  Save the file.  The run 'sudo apt-get update'
tnx (I use kubuntu: sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list)
oh right
can I do sudo apt-get upgrade
sudo apt-get update
upgrade will upgrade your packages, update will refresh the package list
what about sudo apt-get dist-upgrade (since I have unstable version)

if you are running edgy, then you should dist-upgrade until the stable release.  dist-upgrade can basically remove packages while upgrade can't.  'man apt-get' has a good description of the difference
tnx again
np
how are you installing?
it is installed
why were you looking for python?  What do you want to do?

I thought version ov python was the reason for error code, when I tryed to run "Amarok Shouter" - internet radion so ppls could lusten my radio but looks like version of python isn't the issue (it's allready instaled the newest one)
